com.versant.fund
Interface Predicate

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public interface Predicate
extends java.lang.Cloneable

Predicate is used to specify predicates for selects. (Predicates are immutable after construction.)

Method Summary
 Predicate and(Predicate x)
          Return the conjunction of this predicate and the argument.
 Predicate not()
          Return the negation of this predicate.
 Predicate or(Predicate x)
          Return the disjunction of this predicate and the argument.
 Predicate withPathPolicy(int flag)
          Set flag to be used in a path query.
 

Method Detail

and

Predicate and(Predicate x)
Return the conjunction of this predicate and the argument.

Parameters:
x - The Predicate to use in the conjunction.

or

Predicate or(Predicate x)
Return the disjunction of this predicate and the argument.

Parameters:
x - The Predicate to use in the disjunction.

not

Predicate not()
Return the negation of this predicate.

withPathPolicy

Predicate withPathPolicy(int flag)
Set flag to be used in a path query.

Parameters:
flag - The flag to be used in the path policy Options for flag are:

  • 0 ("exists")
      • Return a starting point object if there exists one complete path for which the predicate evaluates true.
  • Constants.O_ALL_PATHS
      • Return a starting point object if there is at least one complete path and if all complete paths have a predicate that evaluates true.
  • Constants.O_EMPTY_TRUE
      • Return a starting point object if there exists one complete path with a true predicate OR if no paths are complete.
You can apply multiple path criteria with the | operator. A useful combination is the following.

O_ALL_PATHS | O_EMPTY_TRUE

    Return a starting point object if there are no complete paths ("empty succeeds") OR if all complete paths have a predicate that evaluates true.
